question: The atmosphere is the layer of air surrounding the Earth.
The hydrosphere includes all landforms such as mountains and valleys.
Oceans, rivers, and lakes are part of the lithosphere.
The biosphere consists of all living organisms, including humans, animals, and plants.
The atmosphere contains gases like oxygen, nitrogen, and carbon dioxide.
The lithosphere includes water bodies like lakes and oceans.
Rainfall is a part of the hydrosphere.
Mountains, rocks, and soil are included in the biosphere.
The biosphere depends on the atmosphere, lithosphere, and hydrosphere for survival.
Forests and farmlands are part of the lithosphere.
